title: Referendum against reduction of hiking trails
wording: Hiking trails are a cultural heritage. The planned reduction of trail maintenance must be stopped. Hikers demand that all existing trails continue to be maintained.

title: Initiative for accessible Internet (Access Initiative)
wording: Websites of authorities as well as publicly supported or subsidized actors must be accessible without barriers. All people must be able to use information and services.

title: For more shaded spaces in public areas (Sun protection initiative)
wording: Additional trees and canopies must be created in public spaces. This makes hot days more bearable for children, seniors and everyone who is outside.

title: Initiative for more drinking water fountains (Fountain Initiative)
wording: More public drinking water fountains must be installed in cities and villages. This makes access to fresh water easier for everyone â€“ healthy, sustainable and free.

title: No drastic cuts to reading promotion
wording: Planned cuts to reading promotion must be stopped. They particularly affect libraries: important meeting places for knowledge, culture and exchange.

title: Initiative for free school fruit (Snack Initiative)
wording: All primary school students should receive free fruit. This promotes healthy nutrition, prevents diseases and strengthens equal opportunities.

title: More bicycle parking spaces at the station (Bike parking initiative)
wording: Commuters need secure parking spaces for their bikes. This initiative demands that sufficient modern and covered bicycle parking spaces be set up at all stations.
